column4: anyone knows how to do a 'dd' with the udev system over ubuntu?
anyone knows how to do a 'dd' with the udev system over ubuntu?
could you explain this a bit more ?

there is no fd0 at ubuntu. if you put a floppy and double click the floppy icon it uses udev kernel module to identify the floppy and mount at the fstab defined place. at kernel 2.6 there is no floppy block device
on my ubunt tere is one.....(havent used my floppy yet....)
there is fd in mine, but not fd0
grep fd /var/log/dmesg
should tell: Floppy drive(s): fd0 is 1.44M
sorry, do not understand your last msg...
if you run: grep fd /var/log/dmesg in a terminal, you should get the output: Floppy drive(s): fd0 is 1.44M
hotplug should care for this on boot
this command results nothing
i will try hotplug again
looks like something with hotplug is wrong, is your system up to date ?
yes, it is...
i will redo an apt-get update
and a dist-upgrade ;)
apt-get update and dist-upgrade just resulted in libpng updates
and it is not retriving some sources...
so try running a: sudo modprobe floppy to get the module working at least
YEAH!!! now i have a floppy drive!! THANKS man!!
you can make it permanent if you add floppy to /etc/modules
shure i will!!!
